content.description: 12 bolts. Crux is between the 2nd and 3rd bolts on the head wall. excellent quality rock. You can stem off the opposite wall of the chimney in places.  Wear a helmet. It's possible to glance off the opposite wall if you fall.
content.location: to the right of and on the same wall as Hip Pockets.

content.description: Climb pillar, then step to main face at slightly chossy section. Head up the steep face after this.
crux at 4th bolt. super fun. this is my daily warmup when down at the belt
content.location: this route is left of wedjo and the 5.7. pretty much the left most route at b belt

content.description: climb positive  crimps to the top of the block. Stem left to the crack and climb up and left of the crack. That was the crux. The finish may have a 10a move depending on which way you go.
Climb the right side of a short block, then up a face to a Gold headwall.
content.location: This is also the start of Pocket Dance.

content.description:
A fine arete climb with a funky and spooky start.  This route climbs the arete right of the routes Paradise 5.9 and Monsters of Rock 5.11.

Easy scrambling up to the first bolt about 20' up, the crux comes immediately and once past the second bolt the climbing eases a bit and is just fine.
content.protection: 6 bolts to a rap anchor, lower off with a single 60 meter rope.

content.description: Short an a bit spooky but worth doing to set up the TR on Bloody Pawprints.
content.location: Just right of Bloody, shared anchors

content.description: Start as for Rim Job but take the right bolt line and follow steepening jugs and pockets all the way to the top of the wall. Surely a contender for the best of its grade in the Gorge, this route has become an instant classic.
content.protection:
14 bolts with optional hand piece between bolt 1 and 2 (in the large flake) to two mussy hooks

35m to ledge, 40m to ground
content.location: Up on the ledge a bit right of Love Stinks

content.description: Chimney in corner leads to nice jams and stems past a steep section. After that, enjoyable face climbing continues to the anchors.
content.location: The belayer needs to be on the ledge for this one. It's possible to lower to the ledge with a 70m rope, otherwise, lower to the anchors of "Monsters of Rock", then lower or rap from there.

content.description: Fun steep new route, pretty clean for brand new Owens routes.
content.location: Starts just right of Environmental Terrorist and heads up and right.

content.description: Maybe the best 5.7 in the Gorge.  Unlike another contender, High Seas on Warm Up, this pitch is not polished.
content.location: The leftmost route on Banana Belt, left of a nasty chimney.

content.description: vertical climbing in a chimney. Stem to 3rd bolt then transition to face climbing. Go right to the arete a few bolts from the top for easy climbing. Lots of big holds. it's possible to glance off the opposite side of the chimney if you fall. Wear a helmet. The crux is about 2/3rd of the way up.
content.location: to the right and on the opposite wall from Hip Pockets.

climbs.name: The New Monsters of Rock
climbs.fa: [Updated 2021] Patrick ODonnell, Marty Lewis [Original 1990] Greer, Pottenger

content.description: Climb the same Monsters of Rock route but now take it to 35m rather than ending at an arbitrary anchor at 50'. Bolts were moved/added to make for a classic and fun route. Monsters of Rock rarely got done before due to scary ground fall potential for no apparent reason. Now it is a well protected classic gorge route on excellent quality rock. Same Monsters of Rock start. Do the 11b crux at the bottom and climb another 90 feet of 10a 5star quality gorge rock to an anchor at ~35m. If you don't have an 80m rope, tie a knot and watch your rope for the lower.
content.location: Same start as Monsters of Rock to the right of Paradise 5.9 (the corner to the left).

content.description: A decent shorty featuring typical ORG crimping on nice rock.  The crux is from bolts three through four.  There is a long runout from the last bolt to the anchors on 5.8ish terrain which can be protected with gear in .5" range.  Also, if you're feeling as weenieish as I did when I did MOR, there is a solid but tight green Alien placement between bolts 3 & 4.
content.protection: 4 bolts, optional but recommended yellow Alien.
content.location: MOR starts atop a pedestal, close to where the trail across the river meets the trail that traverses the base of BB.

content.description: Somewhat fun climbing on friable rock- tho the saving grace is that there are plenty of bolts. Crux is a long reach move several bolts from the top. Should have ended the route on the 2nd to last lead bolt. Debatable, in the beginning, if it would ever totally clean up, but seems to be heading there.
content.location: Located just right of Love Sinks. Follows a grotty crack up the wall. 80 meter rope gets one lowered to the ground. 70 meter rope lowers one to the upper ledge with 3rd class down climb. Can be done with 60 meter rope but requires a double rap. Can also be done with 60 meter rope to the first pitch anchor of the route immediately right.

content.description: Very long and steep climb. Thin crux down low (which can be avoided by climbing way right) to steep jug haul to pumpy bulge.
content.location: Can just lower to the large ledge with a 70m rope with the belayer on the ground. Be very careful of rope ends.

content.description: A great route with 3 very different sections. First, strenuous moves getting around and over the roof. Second, getting over the tricky crux bulge. Then after a bit of easier terrain, manage the pump following sequential pockets up the awesome face to the anchor.
content.location: Left of Love Stinks and right of Love Crack

content.description: Tricky face climbing leads to a big roof, rest before the roof and then crank some 11+ moves to gain better holds above. Climb a pocketed face with spaced bolts and eventually up and left to the anchors.
content.location: To the left of hip pockets.

content.description: crack skills will help a bit on this one, but are not required as you can lieback. feels more solid for me to lead than the other 5.9's at b belt
content.location: look for handcrack start just left of the most chaulked up route (love stinks)

content.description: This climb starts up the a thin seam protected by small nuts.  Balancy moves up the seams lead to the first bolt and the crux.  The crux finishes with a reach to a good ledge and the second bolt.  Mantle up and clip a pin.  Now the fun begins.  Head straight up on big positive pockets (small cam placement) and slightly right to another bolt.  Continue up and slightly left on more big pockets and then head back right up low angle rock to an America death triangle anchor.
content.protection: This route was retro bolted in 2011 and there are 12 bolts.

content.description: Thin slab moves to not-as-thin crux to typical Owens face climbing.
Starts up Rim Job but breaks right after the fourth bolt along a flake-like feature, then traverses back left to the anchors of Rim Job.
Quite hard crux after bolt three
content.location: Around the corner to the right of Wormdrive
